snippet: The Labor Department said that the average number of people who applied for benefits over the last four weeks dropped to its lowest level since November 2007.
abstract: Labor Department reports that applications for weekly unemployment benefits increased 5,000 to seasonally adjusted 333,000; level is lowest in almost six years, signalling fewer layoffs.
lead_paragraph: The Labor Department said that the average number of people who applied for benefits over the last four weeks dropped to its lowest level since November 2007.

headline.main: New Claims by Jobless Are Lowest Since 2007
headline.print_headline: New Claims By Jobless Are Lowest Since 2007
